TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is an NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in GPE , GPE . He is represented before the ORG by Mr. GPE , a lawyer practising in GPE , GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant caused a road accident .

On DATE ORG ( GPE ) summoned the applicant as he was suspected of having driven a car in a state of drunkenness . However , he did not obey the summons . On DATE he commented on the suspicion against him .

On DATE ORG issued an order imposing a fine of ATS CARDINAL on the applicant for having driven his car in a state of drunkenness . A test carried out had shown that the applicant had had an alcohol level in his breath of QUANTITY ( the legal limit is QUANTITY ) .
On DATE the applicant , who was assisted by counsel of his own choice , filed an appeal ; he requested an oral hearing .
On DATE ORG ( PERSON the ORG ” ) served a summons for a hearing on DATE on the applicant ’s counsel .
On DATE the ORG , after having held a hearing on DATE , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal .
On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG ) .

On DATE ORG quashed the ORG ’s decision . It found that the decision was based on an unconstitutional provision which provided that LAW ( GPE ) did not apply in road - accident proceedings . According to LAW , if the extenuating circumstances outweigh the aggravating circumstances , the imposed fine may be reduced to CARDINAL of the statutory minimum fine . This decision was served on the applicant ’s counsel on DATE .
On DATE the ORG , sitting with a single member , dismissed the applicant ’s appeal . It found that the requirements of LAW were not met .

On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG against this decision . He stressed that the ORG had failed to hold a hearing in the second set of the proceedings upon his appeal despite his request in his appeal of CARDINAL DATE . He also complained that the decision had not been pronounced in public .

On DATE the ORG submitted its observations in reply . It argued that the applicant had waived his right to a public hearing and a pronouncement in public as he had agreed at the end of the hearing of DATE that no hearing for the pronouncement of the decision should be held .

On DATE the applicant amended his complaint , now stating that the composition of the ORG was unlawful as that member had already decided on his appeal in the first set of the proceedings . Therefore , he challenged that member of the ORG for bias .
On DATE ORG refused to deal with the case for lack of prospects of success .
On DATE the applicant requested that the case be transferred to ORG and on CARDINAL DATE he supplemented his complaint . On DATE the ORG submitted its observations in reply .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint . It found that there was no indication of bias of the member of the ORG . As regards ORG ’s failure to hold a hearing in the second set of the proceedings it found that the applicant had failed to file a new request to hold a hearing . This decision was served on DATE .
Section CARDINALe of the Code of Administrative Offences ( Verwaltungs - strafgesetz ) , as far as relevant , reads as follows :

“ ... CARDINAL . In case the appeal is expressly limited to points of law or concerns exclusively the severity of the sentence imposed , a hearing must only be scheduled if this is expressly requested in the appeal .
CARDINAL . A hearing need not be held if the parties expressly waive their right to a hearing . The parties may express such a waiver up to the beginning of the hearing . ... ”
Section CARDINAL of LAW ( Verwaltungs - strafgesetz ) , as far as relevant , reads as follows :
“ If the extenuating circumstances considerably outweigh the aggravating circumstances , or if the accused is under age , the minimum fine may be reduced to DATE of the amount . ”
